abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Fourth
            Poverty Reduction Support Credit for Benin is to provide
            support for implementation of the government's reform
            agenda in the following areas: i) improving the policy
            environment for private investment and infrastructure; ii)
            pursuing progress toward the World Bank's Millennium
            Development Goals by improving access to basic services and
            ensuring greater efficiency of public expenditures on human
            capital formation; and iii) promoting better governance
            through financial management, civil service and justice
            reforms. This project is expected to have a significant
            positive impact on poverty reduction. First, through
            components designed to improve the business climate and
            private sector development, the project's operation
            will promote economic growth. Second, the strengthening of
            public financial management is expected to enhance the
            efficiency and effectiveness of public resources in the
            delivery of development services and in reaching the
            Bank's Millennium Development Goals. Third, this
            project supports equitable development through components
            emphasizing access to basic services, such as health,
            education, water and rural transport. The risks for this
            operation include: i) obstacles to the reform agenda; ii)
            weak capacity to implement the reforms; iii) vulnerability
            to commodity and currency rates; and iv) constraints to
            economic diversification. IDA is supporting the government
            of Benin in implementing measures to mitigate these risks
            by: supporting its consistent application of formal
            procedures and grounding reforms in participatory processes
            as well as in the dynamics laid out in the project's
            poverty reduction strategy paper; enhancing dialogue with
            the government of Benin, donor coordination and technical
            assistance; and improving the policy environment for private
            investment and infrastructure, diversifying agricultural
            production and improving the marketing of cotton production.
